description: Redevelopment to provide 3 x 4 bed affordable rented houses with associated car parking, cycle store and amenity space together with re-provision of amenity space for Alexandra Court and car parking for shops in Marnham Court (following demolition of existing garages) (Regulation 3 - Councils own development)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: (A-BA1-S29-DR-) 0001 -; 0002 Rev A; 0005 Rev A; 100 Rev K; 0200 Rev D; 0300 Rev E; 0301 Rev E; Accommodation Schedule ref: EAL-EGS_HTA-A_BA1-S29_SC_0001 Rev L (dated 09/01/2015); Affordable Housing Statement (un-dated), prepared by JLL; Arboricultural Impact Assessment  ref: 56156 (Revised date 09/07/2015), prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd; Construction Management Plan prepared by Hill; Code for Sustainable Homes Ecology Report Rev 01 (dated January 2015) and Preliminary Ecology Appraisal (dated December 2014), prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd; Design and Access Statement Final Issue - Rev C ref: EAL-EGS RP 0001 (dated 04/02/2015), prepared by HTA; Energy Assessment and Code for Sustainable Homes Assessment Final Issue - Rev D ref: EAL-EGS_R_BA1-S29-RP_0002 (dated 03/02/2015), prepared by HTA; Daylight and Sunlight Assessment ref: rs/ROL.142290/1 (dated 26/01/2015), prepared by Dixon Payne; Geo-Environmental Report (dated Januray 2015), prepared by Enzygo; Planning Statement and Statement of Community Involvement (dated February 2015), prepared by JLL; Transport Statement ref: 1407-50/TS/01D Rev D (dated 22/05/2015), prepared by Transport Planning Associates.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved Construction Management Plan prepared by Hill. Prior to the commencement of any site work, all sensitive properties within or surrounding the site shall be notified in writing of the nature and duration of the works to be undertaken, and the name and address of a responsible person to whom enquiries / complaints should be directed. These details shall also be displayed at regular intervals around the site compound. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved.  Reason:  In order to ensure that appropriate mitigation measures are out in place to protect the amenity of local residents that live in close proximity to the demolition and construction site and to ensure adequate highway and site safety,and the safe and continued use of Transport for London's bus stop located immediately to the south of the application site, in accordance with policies 5.3, 5.18, 6.3, 7.14, 7.15 and 7.19 of the London Plan 2015; policies 1.1(e), 1.1(f) and 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD; (Interim) SPG 10: Noise and Vibration; the National Planning Policy Framework (2012); the Greater London Authority SPG 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition' (2014), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise. | Development shall not commence until a suitable monitoring programme for the tree protection measures detailed in the approved Arboricultural Impact Assessment  ref: 56156 (Revised date 09/07/2015), prepared by Landscape Planning Ltd has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval. The monitoring program shall include the following: - Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development. - Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key responsibilities and contact details. - Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to Arboricultural matters. - A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all tree protection measures named in the Tree Protection Plan, including: - Prestart meeting with an Ealing Council Tree Officer, - Initial implementation of the tree protection measures,  - Installation of the House Deck system - Final removal of the tree protection measures. - Procedures for dealing with variations or non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement.  The programme of Arboricultural monitoring shall be taken in full compliance with the approved details.  No variation of the approved monitoring program shall take place without the prior written agreement of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: Details of the programme of monitoring the tree works is required prior to the commencement of any site preparation works because such works would carry a high risk of damaging trees and other vegetation particularly by site operatives that are not experienced to carry out works around trees. The protection of trees and other vegetation is required in accordance with policies 7.19 and 7.21 of the London Plan (2015), and interim SPG 9 'Trees and Development Guidelines'. | Sound insulation and noise control measures for the approved residential dwellings shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets described at Section 4(B) 'Criteria for adequate protection for new buildings' of Ealing's interim SPG 10:  Bedrooms (23:00-0700 hrs) 30 dB LAeq, and 45 dB Lmax (fast) Living rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 35dB LAeq Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (0700-2300 hrs) 45 dB LAeq  The sound insulation and noise control measures shall be installed prior to the first use and / or first occupation of the relevant part of the development and maintained thereafter.  Reason: To protect the amenity of the residential occupiers of the new development, in accordance with policies 3.2, 3.18 and 7.15 of the London Plan 2015; policy 1.1(j) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012; policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013); the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG; and interim SPG 10: Noise and Vibration. | Prior to the commencement of works excluding demolition, site clearance and preparation works, the following details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval: a) An intrusive contaminated land investigation and risk assessment of the site, carried out in accordance with BS1075:2011+A1:2013 and CR11 guidance, to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site. This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person and shall assess any contamination on the site.   b) A contamination remediation scheme to bring the relevant part of the site to a condition suitable for the intended end use. The scope of the remediation scheme shall include details of all works to be undertaken, proposed remediation objectives and remediation criteria, a timetable of works and site management procedures.  The remediation scheme must ensure that the site will not qualify as contaminated land under Part 2A of the Environmental Protection Act 1990 in relation to the intended use of the land after remediation.  Within six-months of the completion of measures identified in the approved contamination remediation scheme, a verification report (in accordance with the Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1') that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for written approval.   Reason: Further investigations of the presence of soil contamination within the application site and details of the methods for remediation are required before the commencement of building works in order to ensure that human health and the environment are protected, and to ensure the development activities do not activate or spread contamination in accordance with policies LV5.21 and 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy 5.21 of the London Plan 2015, and the Mayor's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. | Details and samples of all facing materials shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any work commencing on the superstructure of the development. The samples and details shall include (where relevant): a) brickwork (including brick panels and mortar courses); b) render (including details of colour and texture) (as relevant); c) cladding materials, including roof finishes; d) all window treatments (including details of window certification for Secured by Design); e) building entrance details and material samples (including details of door certification for Secured by Design); f) any other materials to be used.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved and retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are of a high-quality specification and make a positive contribution to the townscape, in accordance with policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy 1.1(h) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012, and policies 7.1 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2015. | The dedicated refuse and recycling enclosures in the front gardens, and the bicycle stores in the rear gardens of the approved houses shall be provided in accordance with the approved plans prior to the first occupation of any dwelling and retained for that purpose thereafter.  Reason:  To secure the necessary recycling and waste enclosures and bicycle storage facilities, to support the development and to ensure that responsible waste management practices are adhered to in the interests of the visual amenity of the area; and in order to ensure that sufficient storage facilities are provided for the storage of bicycles in the interest of encouraging sustainable transport options for the future occuapants,  in accordance with policies 5.17 and 6.9 of the London Plan (2015); policy 1.1(e) of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy (2012); and policies 7A, LV7.4 and 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Within six months of the commencement of the development, the details of the proposed boundary treatments, hard and soft landscaping for the site, and external lighting in the rear car parking court, shall be submitted to the Local Planning authority for written approval.  The approved boundary treatments, site landscaping and external lighting shall be provided in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the approved houses and retained thereafter.  The details of the external lighting scheme shall include a statement confirming that the requirements of BS 5489:2013, or justification as to why the requirements cannot be met.  Reason: To ensure that the boundary treatments, landscaping and external lighting proposals are fit for purpose, enhance the amenity and security of future and existing occupants of the site and neighbouring sites, and that external lighting meets the Crime Prevention Design Advisors recommendations in relation to provide the highest level of safety for those using the rear car parking court; in accordance with policies 7.2, 7.3 and 7.4 of the London Plan (2015), and policies 7A, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification) no development to any dwellinghouse hereby approved under Classes A-H (inclusive) of Part 1, Schedule 2 to the said Order shall be carried out or constructed without express planning permission.   Reason:  To enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain control over extensions and other alterations to dwellinghouses in the interests of the design and character of the properties, the visual amenities of the locality and amenities of occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2015), policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(f) of the Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy 2012 and policies LV7.4, 7B and 7D of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013).
